meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's me, your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer, here to give you the lowdown on Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling. Now, I know what you're thinking - another otome visual novel? Yeah, yeah, I get it. But trust me, this one's got some sweet (and spicy) treats for you.

First off, let's talk about the critics. Oh boy, did they ever get their feels in a twist! Some thought it was too confusing (GLHF on Sports Illustrated), while others praised its unique artistry (Cubed3). And then there were those who just wanted to jump into the fun without playing the original (Gamer Escape).

Now, let's get to the good stuff. Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is like a delicious box of chocolates - you never know what kind of romantic adventure you'll get! The game takes the best parts of its predecessor and amplifies them with improved storytelling and characters. And don't even get me started on those gorgeous graphics!

But, as with any fandisc, there are some concerns about world-building and character development (Gamer Escape). I mean, we get it - sometimes you want a deeper dive into the lore and personalities of your favorite bachelors. Still, Sweet and Spicy Darling does an admirable job of balancing its stories with humor and relatable issues.

So, should you play Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling? Absolutely! But don't say I didn't warn you - this one's got some serious feels going on. Grab a box of tissues (or two, or three...), get cozy, and indulge in the romance!

In conclusion, if you're looking for a sweet and spicy adventure that'll keep you hooked from start to finish, Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is the perfect choice. Just remember, Hippo Penny said so - and I'm always right!
